newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: NWE oil products all firm with rising futures.
newsitem.headline: NWE oil products all firm with rising futures.

text.p: NWE oil products all firmed on Wednesday after crude extended late Tuesday's gains, dealers said.
Gasoline rose by around $4 a tonne. Winter Eurograde traded at $214 fob, summer Eurograde at $213, $214 and $215. Late morning offers for summer grade were at around $217 fob Rotterdam.
The buoyant prompt physical market led to a $2 backwardation between April and May swaps.

Heating oil barges were up some $4 a tonne, but were very thinly traded. Some wholesalers with short positions, however, were more keen to discuss trade but were little interested in offers which held at IPE April -$1 fob ARA.
High sulphur fuel oil barges traded once at $90 fob Rotterdam. The trading house that has bought the market at steadily higher levels in the past week was, for once, the seller.
Bunker market demand remained low, somewhat below 10,000 tonnes.
